issue.title: Simple Note-Taking CLI App
issue.body:
## Overview
Build a simple command-line note-taking app in TypeScript.

## Requirements

### Features
1. Add a note with title and content
2. List all notes
3. Delete a note by ID
4. Search notes by keyword

### Technical
- TypeScript
- Store notes in a JSON file (notes.json)
- Use commander.js for CLI parsing
- Simple and clean code

### Commands
```
notes add --title "My Note" --content "Note content here"
notes list
notes delete --id 1
notes search --keyword "meeting"
```

### File Structure
```
src/
  index.ts    # CLI entry point
  notes.ts    # Note operations
  storage.ts  # JSON file storage
  types.ts    # TypeScript types
```

Keep it simple!

ems.task: Create project foundation: .gitignore with node/dist patterns, package.json with dependencies (commander, types/node), tsconfig.json for ES2020 target, and src/ folder structure

workers.task: Create .gitignore file with node/ and dist/ patterns, package.json with name='notes-cli', version='1.0.0', bin='src/index.ts', dependencies commander and typescript, devDependencies @types/node and ts-node, and scripts for build and start
Create tsconfig.json with compilerOptions targeting ES2020, module commonjs, outDir ./dist, rootDir ./src, strict mode true, and include/exclude patterns for src/ and node_modules/
Create src/ folder structure with empty placeholder files: index.ts (CLI entry point), notes.ts (note operations), storage.ts (JSON file storage), and types.ts (TypeScript interfaces)

analysisSummary: Implement a TypeScript-based CLI note-taking application with add, list, delete, and search functionality. Notes are persisted to a JSON file using commander.js for CLI argument parsing. The implementation follows a clean modular architecture with separate files for CLI entry point, note operations, storage, and TypeScript types.
